Uses of Class
GridState

    • Uses of GridState in <Unnamed>

      Methods in <Unnamed> that return GridState 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GridState GridState.getParentState()
      Returns the state's parent state.
      GridState FileIO.getStartState()
      Returns the starting state of the puzzle to be solved.
      GridState FileIO.getTargetState()
      Returns the state of the puzzle the algorithm is to try and get to in order to solve the puzzle.
      Methods in <Unnamed> that return types with arguments of type GridState 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<GridState> GridState.getChildren()
      Returns the possible grid states that are generated as a result of a move of the current state's gap (zero).
      java.util.ArrayList<GridState> Path.getPath()
      Returns the path of the algorithm.
      Methods in <Unnamed> with parameters of type GridState 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Path.addToStart(GridState state)
      Adds a GridState object to the start of the path instance variable (adds it at index 0 of the ArrayList).
      int AStarSearch.calculateHammingDistance(GridState current, GridState target)
      Calculates the number of tiles in the particular state that are out of place from the target state.
      int AStarSearch.calculateManhattanDistance(GridState current, GridState target)
      Calculates the sum of the distances each tile is away from where it should be, as defined by the target state passed in.
      Path BreadthFirstSearch.findPath(GridState initialState, GridState targetState)
      Carries out the breadth first search algorithm on the 8-puzzle to be solved.
      Path DepthFirstSearch.findPath(GridState initialState, GridState targetState)
      Carries out the depth first search algorithm on the 8 puzzle to be solved.
      Path AStarSearch.findPath(GridState startState, GridState targetState, java.lang.String heuristic)
      Carries out the A Star (A*) search algorithm based on the heuristic chosen by the user in the command line arguments in order to attempt to find the shortest path from the Initial State to the Target State.
      void GridState.setParentState(GridState parent)
      Sets the state's parent.
